One word to sum this video up!!

IDIOTS!!

Some bees had built their comb in a hollow trunk of an oak tree. However the drones claimed that they had done all the work and the comb belonged to them not the bees.
They brought their case to court before judge wasp, who knew something about both parties and addressed them follows:"the plaintiffs and defendants are so much alike in shape and color that the rights to the ownership of the comb are indeed questionable, and the case has been properly brought before me. Therefore, I order each party take a hive to itself and build a new comb so the lawful proprietors of the property in dispute may be determined from the shape of the cells and the taste of the honey ". The bees readily assented to the wasp's plan but the drones declined. As a result the wasp declared that it is now clear who made the comb and who cannot make it. The court Grant's the honey to the bees. Much sweeter than Solomon's judgment.

This is old. I remember watching reviews of this crap. You build it yourself, but a common problem is parts are lazily laser cut and aren't the right size so you have to cut it apart yourself to make them fit.
You also have a problem with the bee's trying to eat the wood and sealing part together with wax. And as the comment above said this beehives isn't good for bee's.
gimmick.

I've seen these. Please, if ever you find yourself in ownership of one and a hive, don't stop thinking about your hard little workers and provide them a shorter trip to pollinate with a garden nearby and some fresh water :) bees really are marvelous creatures and we owe them so much. Just my two cents.

These beehives have existed for a long time and beekeepers and bee specialists keep saying again and again these are awful for the bees

This product would trick the bees into thinking that there are full honeycombs of honey when it has been harvested already. I see this product being appealing to people who aren't accustomed with beekeeping but overall harm the productivity of a hive.
